The product has a 33.33% chance of being high quality and a 66.67% chance of being low quality.

Expected value = (probability of high quality * value of high quality) + (probability of low quality * value of low quality)

## Step 3: Compare the expected value to the price of the product

Alice has not sold any high-quality products yet, but this does not change the probability of the current product being high quality.

Since the expected value is less than the price of the product, it is not a good idea to buy the product.
